text: XXIV .

text: Miss Bingley ’s letter arrived , and put an end to doubt .
text_tokenized: Miss Bingley ’s letter arrived , and put an end to doubt .

text: The very first sentence conveyed the assurance of their being all settled in London for the winter , and concluded with her brother ’s regret at not having had time to pay his respects to his friends in Hertfordshire before he left the country . Hope was over , entirely over ; and when Jane could attend to the rest of the letter , she found little , except the professed affection of the writer , that could give her any comfort .
text_tokenized: The very first sentence conveyed the assurance of their being all settled in London for the winter , and concluded with her brother ’s regret at not having had time to pay his respects to his friends in Hertfordshire before he left the country . Hope was over , entirely over ; and when Jane could attend to the rest of the letter , she found little , except the professed affection of the writer , that could give her any comfort .

text: Miss Darcy ’s praise occupied the chief of it .
text_tokenized: Miss Darcy ’s praise occupied the chief of it .

text: Her many attractions were again dwelt on ; and Caroline boasted joyfully of their increasing intimacy , and ventured to predict the accomplishment of the wishes which had been unfolded in her former letter .
text_tokenized: Her many attractions were again dwelt on ; and Caroline boasted joyfully of their increasing intimacy , and ventured to predict the accomplishment of the wishes which had been unfolded in her former letter .

text: She wrote also with great pleasure of her brother ’s being an inmate of Mr. Darcy ’s house , and mentioned with raptures some plans of the latter with regard to new furniture .
text_tokenized: She wrote also with great pleasure of her brother ’s being an inmate of Mr. Darcy ’s house , and mentioned with raptures some plans of the latter with regard to new furniture .

text: Elizabeth , to whom Jane very soon communicated the chief of all this , heard it in silent indignation .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth , to whom Jane very soon communicated the chief of all this , heard it in silent indignation .

text: Her heart was divided between concern for her sister and resentment against all others .
text_tokenized: Her heart was divided between concern for her sister and resentment against all others .

text: To Caroline ’s assertion of her brother ’s being partial to Miss Darcy , she paid no credit .
text_tokenized: To Caroline ’s assertion of her brother ’s being partial to Miss Darcy , she paid no credit .

text: That he was really fond of Jane , she doubted no more than she had ever done ; and much as she had always been disposed to like him , she could not think without anger , hardly without contempt , on that easiness of temper , that want of proper resolution , which now made him the slave of his designing friends , and led him to sacrifice his own happiness to the caprice of their inclinations .
text_tokenized: That he was really fond of Jane , she doubted no more than she had ever done ; and much as she had always been disposed to like him , she could not think without anger , hardly without contempt , on that easiness of temper , that want of proper resolution , which now made him the slave of his designing friends , and led him to sacrifice his own happiness to the caprice of their inclinations .

text: Had his own happiness , however , been the only sacrifice , he might have been allowed to sport with it in whatever manner he thought best ; but her sister ’s was involved in it , as she thought he must be sensible himself .
text_tokenized: Had his own happiness , however , been the only sacrifice , he might have been allowed to sport with it in whatever manner he thought best ; but her sister ’s was involved in it , as she thought he must be sensible himself .

text: It was a subject , in short , on which reflection would be long indulged , and must be unavailing .
text_tokenized: It was a subject , in short , on which reflection would be long indulged , and must be unavailing .

text: She could think of nothing else ; and yet , whether Bingley ’s regard had really died away , or were suppressed by his friends ’ interference ; whether he had been aware of Jane ’s attachment , or whether it had escaped his observation ; whichever were the case , though her opinion of him must be materially affected by the difference , her sister ’s situation remained the same , her peace equally wounded .
text_tokenized: She could think of nothing else ; and yet , whether Bingley ’s regard had really died away , or were suppressed by his friends ’ interference ; whether he had been aware of Jane ’s attachment , or whether it had escaped his observation ; whichever were the case , though her opinion of him must be materially affected by the difference , her sister ’s situation remained the same , her peace equally wounded .

text: A day or two passed before Jane had courage to speak of her feelings to Elizabeth ; but at last , on Mrs. Bennet ’s leaving them together , after a longer irritation than usual about Netherfield and its master , she could not help saying,-- “ O that my dear mother had more command over herself !
text_tokenized: A day or two passed before Jane had courage to speak of her feelings to Elizabeth ; but at last , on Mrs. Bennet ’s leaving them together , after a longer irritation than usual about Netherfield and its master , she could not help saying,-- “ O that my dear mother had more command over herself !

text: Elizabeth looked at her sister with incredulous solicitude , but said nothing .

text: “ You doubt me , ” cried Jane , slightly colouring ; “ indeed , you have no reason .
text_tokenized: “ You doubt me , ” cried Jane , slightly colouring ; “ indeed , you have no reason .

text: A little time , therefore -- I shall certainly try to get the better---- ” With a stronger voice she soon added , “ I have this comfort immediately , that it has not been more than an error of fancy on my side , and that it has done no harm to anyone but myself . ”

text: “ My dear Jane , ” exclaimed Elizabeth , “ you are too good .
text_tokenized: “ My dear Jane , ” exclaimed Elizabeth , “ you are too good .

text: Your sweetness and disinterestedness are really angelic ; I do not know what to say to you .
text_tokenized: Your sweetness and disinterestedness are really angelic ; I do not know what to say to you .

text: I feel as if I had never done you justice , or loved you as you deserve . ”
text_tokenized: I feel as if I had never done you justice , or loved you as you deserve . ”

text: Miss Bennet eagerly disclaimed all extraordinary merit , and threw back the praise on her sister ’s warm affection .
text_tokenized: Miss Bennet eagerly disclaimed all extraordinary merit , and threw back the praise on her sister ’s warm affection .

text: “ Nay , ” said Elizabeth , “ this is not fair .
text_tokenized: “ Nay , ” said Elizabeth , “ this is not fair .

text: _ You _ wish to think all the world respectable , and are hurt if I speak ill of anybody .
text_tokenized: _ You _ wish to think all the world respectable , and are hurt if I speak ill of anybody .

text: _ I _ only want to think _ you _ perfect , and you set yourself against it .
text_tokenized: _ I _ only want to think _ you _ perfect , and you set yourself against it .

text: Do not be afraid of my running into any excess , of my encroaching on your privilege of universal good - will .
text_tokenized: Do not be afraid of my running into any excess , of my encroaching on your privilege of universal good - will .

text: You need not .
text_tokenized: You need not .

text: There are few people whom I really love , and still fewer of whom I think well .
text_tokenized: There are few people whom I really love , and still fewer of whom I think well .

text: The more I see of the world the more am I dissatisfied with it ; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters , and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of either merit or sense .

text_tokenized: You do not make allowance enough for difference of situation and temper .

text: Consider Mr. Collins ’s respectability , and Charlotte ’s prudent , steady character .
text_tokenized: Consider Mr. Collins ’s respectability , and Charlotte ’s prudent , steady character .

text: Remember that she is one of a large family ; that as to fortune it is a most eligible match ; and be ready to believe , for everybody ’s sake , that she may feel something like regard and esteem for our cousin . ”
text_tokenized: Remember that she is one of a large family ; that as to fortune it is a most eligible match ; and be ready to believe , for everybody ’s sake , that she may feel something like regard and esteem for our cousin . ”

text: “ To oblige you , I would try to believe almost anything , but no one else could be benefited by such a belief as this ; for were I persuaded that Charlotte had any regard for him , I should only think worse of her understanding than I now do of her heart .
text_tokenized: “ To oblige you , I would try to believe almost anything , but no one else could be benefited by such a belief as this ; for were I persuaded that Charlotte had any regard for him , I should only think worse of her understanding than I now do of her heart .

text: My dear Jane , Mr. Collins is a conceited , pompous , narrow - minded , silly man : you know he is , as well as I do ; and you must feel , as well as I do , that the woman who marries him can not have a proper way of thinking .

text: Mrs. Bennet still continued to wonder and repine at his returning no more ; and though a day seldom passed in which Elizabeth did not account for it clearly , there seemed little chance of her ever considering it with less perplexity .

text: Her daughter endeavoured to convince her of what she did not believe herself , that his attentions to Jane had been merely the effect of a common and transient liking , which ceased when he saw her no more ; but though the probability of the statement was admitted at the time , she had the same story to repeat every day .

text: Miss Bennet was the only creature who could suppose there might be any extenuating circumstances in the case unknown to the society of Hertfordshire : her mild and steady candour always pleaded for allowances , and urged the possibility of mistakes ; but by everybody else Mr. Darcy was condemned as the worst of men .

text: After a week spent in professions of love and schemes of felicity , Mr. Collins was called from his amiable Charlotte by the arrival of Saturday .

text: “ She will drop the acquaintance entirely . ” But , in spite of the certainty in which Elizabeth affected to place this point , as well as the still more interesting one of Bingley ’s being withheld from seeing Jane , she felt a solicitude on the subject which convinced her , on examination , that she did not consider it entirely hopeless .
